intro: Machaeranthera subalpina, commonly known as the alpine blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs in late summer, and it is known for its striking, spiky blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Machaeranthera subalpina is an important component of alpine ecosystems and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
